docs.snippet: Many of the factors that hurt last week’s earnings will be minor this week, but companies like Apple and Facebook have their own challenges.

headline.main: Different Issues for Next Wave of Tech Earnings Reports

docs.snippet: Twitter, Facebook, Google and Amazon shared their second-quarter earnings reports, and Yahoo agreed to sell itself to Verizon for about $5 billion.

headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: The Cautionary Tale of the Fall of Yahoo

docs.snippet: The pleasures — and complexities — of severing social media ties.
Silicon Valley has fallen in love with A.I. assistants, but so far they’re hardly impressive. Is it the industry’s fault, or is it ours?

headline.print_headline: What Chatbots Reveal About Our Own Shortcomings
headline.main: What Chatbots Reveal About Our Own Shortcomings

docs.snippet: Our soon-to-be Tokyo bureau chief learns to love Snapchat.

headline.print_headline: With Obama in Japan, and a Puppy in Brooklyn
headline.main: With Obama in Japan, and a Puppy in Brooklyn

docs.snippet: The former All-Star pitcher was fired from his position as an ESPN baseball analyst a day after he was criticized for promoting offensive commentary about transgender people.

headline.print_headline: ESPN Fires Schilling Over an Offensive Post
headline.main: Curt Schilling, ESPN Analyst, Is Fired Over Offensive Social Media Post

docs.snippet: Prosecutors wanted to keep Facebook from telling users about 15 subpoenas of their data. But a judge refused, saying the need for them was not specific enough.

headline.print_headline: Judge Will Not Force Facebook’s Silence on Subpoenas
headline.main: Brooklyn Judge Will Not Force Facebook’s Silence on Subpoenas

docs.abstract: James Orenstein, federal judge in Brooklyn, rules prosecutors cannot force Facebook to keep from telling its customers about 15 grand-jury subpoenas of their data.

docs.snippet: There may be no love lost between Donald Trump and the tech world, but he is likely to need tech backers as his campaign turns to the general election.

headline.print_headline: Few Likes for Trump From Silicon Valley
headline.main: Silicon Valley Finds Trump’s Disruption Unwelcome

docs.abstract: Political strategists say presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump, who has been critical of Silicon Valley, needs to court tech industry in order to power his campaign.

docs.snippet: Four people involved in the creation of an industry partnership say its intent will be clear: to ensure that A.I. research is focused on things that will benefit people, not hurt them.

headline.print_headline: Devising Real Ethics for Artificial Intelligence
headline.main: How Tech Giants Are Devising Real Ethics for Artificial Intelligence

docs.abstract: Researchers from world's largest tech companies, including Alphabet, Amazon, Facebook, IBM and Microsoft are studying impact of artificial intelligence and creating entity to regulate AI research and development; project hopes to appease concerns intelligent technology will imperil humanity's future.

docs.snippet: If one company has a small success, the others pile on, and you get “30 different versions of some dumb wearable.” Also, meet Mike’s flower guy, Guy.

headline.main: Farhad and Mike’s Week in Tech: The Herd Mentality of Tech C.E.O.s
